description: Repeatedly apply Euler phi to n; a(n) = highest power of 2 that is seen.
example: If n is a power of 2, then it is of largest exponent. If n=2400, then its phi-sequence is {2400,640,256,128,64,32,16,8,4,2,1}. The value of first power of 2 is 256. Thus a(2400)=256.
author: _Labos Elemer_
